content: I really like the personal touch in this piece. The frustration and anger reads sincere. So many things to highlight and comment on, but I definitely think one book that adds a good perspective on this issue is called “Glock” by Paul Barrett. I’d say this is one of the more complicated issues to fix legislatively and socially, but your column offers a great nuanced opinion, which is something I think is missing from the usual binary pro/anti talks.
